title: Portion Distortion: When Normal Became Huge
description: A quick win: understand Portion Distortion: When Normal Became Huge.

hook.text: A 'regular' soda in the 1950s was 7 ounces. Today a 'small' is 16. Portions grew without us noticing.

buildup.text: Studies show people eat 30% more when given larger portions ‚Äî regardless of hunger level.

discovery.text: Cornell's 'bottomless soup bowl' experiment proved people ate 73% more from a secretly self-refilling bowl.

twist.text: We rely on visual cues to judge 'enough.' When the portion is the cue, larger becomes the new normal.

climax.text: Since 1970, average plate diameter grew from 9 inches to 12 ‚Äî serving sizes expanded to match.

punchline.text: We didn't get greedier. The plates got bigger.
